sm::eod::SerializableFactory

SerializableFactory Class Reference

#include <serializablefactory.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Factory for creating new Serializable objects.

Factory class for Serializable objects. You can request a new object from the factory by passing in an ID. The factory returns a base-class pointer (allocated on the heap) that points to a new object of the type specified by the ID

Member Function Documentation

static bool canDeserialize ( const std::vector< uint8 > &  buffer,
int  read_pos = 0 
) [static]

Returns true of there is enough data to deserialize the object at read_pos.

First checks if there is enough data for an object header and if so, then determines the data size from the header and checks that there is enough data in the buffer.

static SerializablePtr newObject ( std::istream &  s  )  [static]

Create a new SerializableObject from an open input stream.

Parameters:
s Input stream to read the serialized object data from. This function assumes the current read position is set to the start of a serialized object in the stream. This method reads one Serializable object from the stream and returns it, updating the stream's read position accordingly. If the object's ID is unrecognised, that object will be skipped over, and a null pointer is returned
Exceptions:
SerializableError if reading from the stream failed, or an error occured whilst unserializing the buffer, or the stream is at the end of the file.

static SerializablePtr newObject ( const std::vector< uint8 > &  buffer,
int &  read_pos_inout 
) [static]

Create a new Serializable object from the contents of a buffer.

Parameters:
buffer Buffer of bytes to initialise the object from
read_pos_inout The index into buffer to start reading from. Updated by this function to point to the position following the object unless an exception is thrown. Left unmodified if the object id is unknown or an exception is thrown.
Returns:
Pointer to the new Serializable object, or NULL if the object is unrecognised. read_pos will point to where the next object will start.
Exceptions:
SerializableError when: insufficient data in buffer, if an error occured when unserializing from the buffer. Caused by malformed data within a packet. read_pos is left unmodified.

static boost::shared_ptr<T> newObject (  )  [static]

Create and return a new, default initialized Object of the specified type.

The object must define the object id as a static constant named THIS_OBJECT_ID.

Returns:
Pointer to the new object, or NULL if the serializable id was not recognised or the object is not dynamically castable to type T.
Exceptions:
SerializableError if the ID of the new object does not match object_id

static SerializablePtr newObjectWithStatus ( std::istream &  s,
DeserializationStatusFlags &  status_inout 
) [static]

Create a new SerializableObject from an open input stream.

This function assumes the current read position is set to the start of a serialized object in the stream. This method reads one Serializable object from the stream and returns it, updating the stream's read position accordingly. If the object's ID is unrecognised, that object will be skipped over, and a null pointer is returned.

Parameters:
s Input stream to read the serialized object data from.
status_inout Status flags updated to reflect the deserialization status.
Returns:
The deserialized object or NULL.
Exceptions:
SerializableError if the factory for the object id creates an object with a different object id.

static SerializablePtr newObjectWithStatus ( const std::vector< uint8 > &  buffer,
int &  read_pos_inout,
DeserializationStatusFlags &  status_inout 
) [static]

Create a new Serializable object from the contents of a buffer.

Parameters:
buffer Buffer of bytes to initialise the object from.
read_pos_inout The index into buffer to start reading from. Updated by this function to point to the position following the object unless there was insufficient or invalid data to deserialize the object.
status_inout Status flags updated to reflect the deserialization status.
Returns:
Pointer to the new Serializable object, or NULL if the object is unrecognised or invalid. read_pos will point to where the next object will start.
Exceptions:
SerializableError if the factory for the object id creates an object with a different object id.

static SerializablePtr newObjectWithStatus ( Serializable::ObjectID  object_id,
DeserializationStatusFlags &  status_inout 
) [static]

Creates and a new, default initialized Serializable Object with the specified ID.

Parameters:
object_id ID of the object to create.
status_inout DeserializationStatusFlags to possibly update. If the object_id is unknown then the DESERIALIZATION_UNKNOWN_OBJECT_ID bit flag is set.
Returns:
Pointer to the new Serializable object, or NULL if the serializable id was not recognised
Exceptions:
SerializableError if the ID of the new object does not match object_id

static CreateObjectFunPtr registerObjectType ( Serializable::ObjectID  object_id,
CreateObjectFunPtr  creation_fn_ptr 
) [static]

Register a Serializable object type.

Parameters:
object_id A unique object identifier
creation_fn_ptr Pointer to a creation function which creates objects of the type associated with object_id
Returns:
any creation function pointer previously registered for the specified object_id (NULL if no creation function has previously been registered).
This function can be used to register a different creation function than any previously registered for the specified object_id, as long as the function returns an object of the same type as that previously registered, and whose objectID() function return value matches object_id.

Exceptions:
SerializableError under the following invalid conditions:
  • creation_fn_ptr is a NULL pointer
  • creation_fn_ptr points to function which returns a NULL pointer
  • creation_fn_ptr generates a object type different to an object already registered.
  • creation_fn_ptr generates an object whose objectID() return value does not match the object_id argument.
Note:
:
  • This static function should not be called by static initialization code (i.e it shouldn't be called until main())
  • This function is NOT thread-safe (i.e do not register object while serializing/deserializing objects)

static CreateObjectFunPtr unregisterObjectType ( Serializable::ObjectID  object_id  )  [static]

Unregisters an object id.

Parameters:
object_id The id that may have been previously registered with registerObjectType()
Returns:
The previous creation function or NULL if the object_id was not registered.
